member.name: F:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.DefaultWhitePoint
member.summary: The default whitepoint used for converting to CieLab

member.name: M:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.WhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used for chromatic adaptation in conversions from/to XYZ color space. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetLuvWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Luv/LChuv colors. (Luv/LChuv colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* Lab/LChab colors. (Lab/LChab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetHunterLabWhitePoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the white point used *when creating* HunterLab colors. (HunterLab colors on the input already contain the white point information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.TargetRgbWorkingSpace
member.summary: Gets or sets the target working space used *when creating* RGB colors. (RGB colors on the input already contain the working space information) Defaults to: .

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Gets or sets the chromatic adaptation method used. When null, no adaptation will be performed.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.LmsAdaptationMatrix
member.summary: Gets or sets transformation matrix used in conversion to , also used in the default Von Kries Chromatic Adaptation method.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.ColorSpaceConverter.IsChromaticAdaptationPerformed
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether chromatic adaptation has been performed.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: Chromatic adaptation. A linear transformation of a source color (XS, YS, ZS) into a destination color (XD, YD, ZD) by a linear transformation [M] which is dependent on the source reference white (XWS, YWS, ZWS) and the destination reference white (XWD, YWD, ZWD).

member.name: M:ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.Conversion.IChromaticAdaptation.Transform(ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz,ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz,ImageSharp.ColorSpaces.CieXyz)
member.summary: Performs a linear transformation of a source color in to the destination color.
member.remarks: Doesn't crop the resulting color space coordinates (e. g. allows negative values for XYZ coordinates).

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel
member.summary: Enumerates the available bits per pixel for bitmap.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel24
member.summary: 24 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 3 bytes.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpBitsPerPixel.Pixel32
member.summary: 32 bits per pixel. Each pixel consists of 4 bytes.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression
member.summary: Defines how the compression type of the image data in the bitmap file.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RGB
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. The format depends on the number of bits, stored in the info header. If the number of bits are one, four or eight each pixel data is a index to the palette. If the number of bits are sixteen, twenty-four or thirty-two each pixel contains a color.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RLE8
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next two half bytes will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.RLE4
member.summary: Two bytes are one data record. If the first byte is not zero, the next byte will be repeated as much as the value of the first byte. If the first byte is zero, the record has different meanings, depending on the second byte. If the second byte is zero, it is the end of the row, if it is one, it is the end of the image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.BitFields
member.summary: Each image row has a multiple of four elements. If the row has less elements, zeros will be added at the right side. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.JPEG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a JPG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpCompression.PNG
member.summary: The bitmap contains a PNG image. Not supported at the moment.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.BmpDecoder
member.summary: Image decoder for generating an image out of a Windows bitmap stream.
member.remarks:
Does not support the following formats at the moment:
JPG
PNG
RLE4
RLE8
BitFields
Formats will be supported in a later releases. We advise always to use only 24 Bit Windows bitmaps.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder
member.summary: Encodes and compresses the image data using dynamic Lempel-Ziv compression.
member.remarks:
Adapted from Jef Poskanzer's Java port by way of J. M. G. Elliott. K Weiner 12/00
GIFCOMPR.C - GIF Image compression routines
Lempel-Ziv compression based on 'compress'. GIF modifications by David Rowley (mgardi@watdcsu.waterloo.edu)
GIF Image compression - modified 'compress'
Based on: compress.c - File compression ala IEEE Computer, June 1984. By Authors: Spencer W. Thomas (decvax!harpo!utah-cs!utah-gr!thomas) Jim McKie (decvax!mcvax!jim) Steve Davies (decvax!vax135!petsd!peora!srd) Ken Turkowski (decvax!decwrl!turtlevax!ken) James A. Woods (decvax!ihnp4!ames!jaw) Joe Orost (decvax!vax135!petsd!joe)

If the isDisposed field is true, then the Dispose() method will not dispose again. This help not to prolong the entity's life in the Garbage Collector.

member.summary: Block compression parameters -- after all codes are used up, and compression rate changes, start over.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.globalInitialBits
member.summary: Algorithm: use open addressing double hashing (no chaining) on the prefix code / next character combination. We do a variant of Knuth's algorithm D (vol. 3, sec. 6.4) along with G. Knott's relatively-prime secondary probe. Here, the modular division first probe is gives way to a faster exclusive-or manipulation. Also do block compression with an adaptive reset, whereby the code table is cleared when the compression ratio decreases, but after the table fills. The variable-length output codes are re-sized at this point, and a special CLEAR code is generated for the decompressor. Late addition: construct the table according to file size for noticeable speed improvement on small files. Please direct questions about this implementation to ames!jaw.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.clearCode
member.summary: The clear code.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.eofCode
member.summary: The end-of-file code.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.LzwEncoder.currentAccumulator
member.summary: Output the given code. Inputs: code: A bitCount-bit integer. If == -1, then EOF. This assumes that bitCount =< wordsize - 1. Outputs: Outputs code to the file. Assumptions: Chars are 8 bits long. Algorithm: Maintain a BITS character long buffer (so that 8 codes will fit in it exactly). Use the VAX insv instruction to insert each code in turn. When the buffer fills up empty it and start over.

member.summary: The current bits.

member.summary: Number of characters so far in this 'packet'

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension
member.summary: The Graphic Control Extension contains parameters used when processing a graphic rendering block.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.DisposalMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the disposal method which indicates the way in which the graphic is to be treated after being displayed.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.TransparencyFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether transparency flag is to be set. This indicates whether a transparency index is given in the Transparent Index field. (This field is the least significant bit of the byte.)

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.TransparencyIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the transparency index. The Transparency Index is such that when encountered, the corresponding pixel of the display device is not modified and processing goes on to the next pixel.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifGraphicsControlExtension.DelayTime
member.summary: Gets or sets the delay time. If not 0, this field specifies the number of hundredths (1/100) of a second to wait before continuing with the processing of the Data Stream. The clock starts ticking immediately after the graphic is rendered.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor
member.summary: Each image in the Data Stream is composed of an Image Descriptor, an optional Local Color Table, and the image data. Each image must fit within the boundaries of the Logical Screen, as defined in the Logical Screen Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets the column number, in pixels, of the left edge of the image, with respect to the left edge of the Logical Screen. Leftmost column of the Logical Screen is 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets the row number, in pixels, of the top edge of the image with respect to the top edge of the Logical Screen. Top row of the Logical Screen is 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the image in pixels.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.LocalColorTableFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the presence of a Local Color Table immediately follows this Image Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.LocalColorTableSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the local color table size. If the Local Color Table Flag is set to 1, the value in this field is used to calculate the number of bytes contained in the Local Color Table.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifImageDescriptor.InterlaceFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the image is to be interlaced. An image is interlaced in a four-pass interlace pattern.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor
member.summary: The Logical Screen Descriptor contains the parameters necessary to define the area of the display device within which the images will be rendered

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width, in pixels, of the Logical Screen where the images will be rendered in the displaying device.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height, in pixels, of the Logical Screen where the images will be rendered in the displaying device.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.BackgroundColorIndex
member.summary: Gets or sets the index at the Global Color Table for the Background Color. The Background Color is the color used for those pixels on the screen that are not covered by an image.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.PixelAspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the pixel aspect ratio. Default to 0.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.GlobalColorTableFlag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a flag denoting the presence of a Global Color Table should be set. If the flag is set, the Global Color Table will immediately follow the Logical Screen Descriptor.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.GifLogicalScreenDescriptor.GlobalColorTableSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the global color table size. If the Global Color Table Flag is set to 1, the value in this field is used to calculate the number of bytes contained in the Global Color Table.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.Jpg.InputProcessor.UnreadByteStuffedByte
member.summary: Undoes the most recent ReadByteStuffedByte call, giving a byte of data back from bits to bytes. The Huffman look-up table requires at least 8 bits for look-up, which means that Huffman decoding can sometimes overshoot and read one or two too many bytes. Two-byte overshoot can happen when expecting to read a 0xff 0x00 byte-stuffed byte.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Jpg.JpegScanDecoder
member.summary:
Encapsulates the impementation of Jpeg SOS Huffman decoding. See JpegScanDecoder.md!
and are the spectral selection bounds. and are the successive approximation high and low values. The spec calls these values Ss, Se, Ah and Al. For progressive JPEGs, these are the two more-or-less independent aspects of progression. Spectral selection progression is when not all of a block's 64 DCT coefficients are transmitted in one pass. For example, three passes could transmit coefficient 0 (the DC component), coefficients 1-5, and coefficients 6-63, in zig-zag order. Successive approximation is when not all of the bits of a band of coefficients are transmitted in one pass. For example, three passes could transmit the 6 most significant bits, followed by the second-least significant bit, followed by the least significant bit. For baseline JPEGs, these parameters are hard-coded to 0/63/0/0.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Formats.Jpg.JpegScanDecoder.DecodeBlocks(ImageSharp.Formats.JpegDecoderCore)
member.summary:
Read Huffman data from Jpeg scans in , and decode it as into .
The blocks are traversed one MCU at a time. For 4:2:0 chroma subsampling, there are four Y 8x8 blocks in every 16x16 MCU. For a baseline 32x16 pixel image, the Y blocks visiting order is: 0 1 4 5 2 3 6 7 For progressive images, the interleaved scans (those with component count > 1) are traversed as above, but non-interleaved scans are traversed left to right, top to bottom: 0 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 Only DC scans (zigStart == 0) can be interleave AC scans must have only one component. To further complicate matters, for non-interleaved scans, there is no data for any blocks that are inside the image at the MCU level but outside the image at the pixel level. For example, a 24x16 pixel 4:2:0 progressive image consists of two 16x16 MCUs. The interleaved scans will process 8 Y blocks: 0 1 4 5 2 3 6 7 The non-interleaved scans will process only 6 Y blocks: 0 1 2 3 4 5

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers
member.summary: Describes common Jpeg markers

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.XFF
member.summary: Marker prefix. Next byte is a marker.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.XFFInt
member.summary: Same as but of type

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOI
member.summary: Start of Image

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF0
member.summary:
Start of Frame (baseline DCT)
Indicates that this is a baseline DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF1
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (Extended Sequential DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOF2
member.summary:
Start Of Frame (progressive DCT)
Indicates that this is a progressive DCT-based JPEG, and specifies the width, height, number of components, and component subsampling (e.g., 4:2:0).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DHT
member.summary:
Define Huffman Table(s)
Specifies one or more Huffman tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DQT
member.summary:
Define Quantization Table(s)
Specifies one or more quantization tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.DRI
member.summary:
Define Restart Interval
Specifies the interval between RSTn markers, in macroblocks. This marker is followed by two bytes indicating the fixed size so it can be treated like any other variable size segment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.RST0
member.summary:
Define First Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.RST7
member.summary:
Define Eigth Restart
Inserted every r macroblocks, where r is the restart interval set by a DRI marker. Not used if there was no DRI marker. The low three bits of the marker code cycle in value from 0 to 7.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.SOS
member.summary:
Start of Scan
Begins a top-to-bottom scan of the image. In baseline DCT JPEG images, there is generally a single scan. Progressive DCT JPEG images usually contain multiple scans. This marker specifies which slice of data it will contain, and is immediately followed by entropy-coded data.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.COM
member.summary:
Comment
Contains a text comment.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegConstants.Markers.EOI
member.summary: End of Image

member.summary: Counts the number of bits needed to hold an integer.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.SosHeaderYCbCr
member.summary: The SOS (Start Of Scan) marker "\xff\xda" followed by 12 bytes: - the marker length "\x00\x0c", - the number of components "\x03", - component 1 uses DC table 0 and AC table 0 "\x01\x00", - component 2 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x02\x11", - component 3 uses DC table 1 and AC table 1 "\x03\x11", - the bytes "\x00\x3f\x00". Section B.2.3 of the spec says that for sequential DCTs, those bytes (8-bit Ss, 8-bit Se, 4-bit Ah, 4-bit Al) should be 0x00, 0x3f, 0x00<<4 | 0x00.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegEncoderCore.UnscaledQuant
member.summary: The unscaled quantization tables in zig-zag order. Each encoder copies and scales the tables according to its quality parameter. The values are derived from section K.1 after converting from natural to zig-zag order.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegSubsample.Ratio444
member.summary: High Quality - Each of the three Y'CbCr components have the same sample rate, thus there is no chroma subsampling.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.JpegSubsample.Ratio420
member.summary: Medium Quality - The horizontal sampling is halved and the Cb and Cr channels are only sampled on each alternate line.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.UnzigData
member.summary: Holds the Jpeg UnZig array in a value/stack type. Unzig maps from the zigzag ordering to the natural ordering. For example, unzig[3] is the column and row of the fourth element in zigzag order. The value is 16, which means first column (16%8 == 0) and third row (16/8 == 2).

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of the various PNG filter types.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType.None
member.summary: With the None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType.Sub
member.summary: The Sub filter transmits the difference between each byte and the value of the corresponding byte of the prior pixel.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType.Up
member.summary: The Up filter is just like the Sub filter except that the pixel immediately above the current pixel, rather than just to its left, is used as the predictor.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType.Average
member.summary: The Average filter uses the average of the two neighboring pixels (left and above) to predict the value of a pixel.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.FilterType.Paeth
member.summary: The Paeth filter computes a simple linear function of the three neighboring pixels (left, above, upper left), then chooses as predictor the neighboring pixel closest to the computed value. This technique is due to Alan W. Paeth

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.NoneFilter
member.summary: The None filter, the scanline is transmitted unmodified; it is only necessary to insert a filter type byte before the data.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk
member.summary: Stores header information about a chunk.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the length. An unsigned integer giving the number of bytes in the chunk's data field. The length counts only the data field, not itself, the chunk type code, or the CRC. Zero is a valid length

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Type
member.summary: Gets or sets the chunk type as string with 4 chars.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data bytes appropriate to the chunk type, if any. This field can be of zero length.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunk.Crc
member.summary: Gets or sets a CRC (Cyclic Redundancy Check) calculated on the preceding bytes in the chunk, including the chunk type code and chunk data fields, but not including the length field. The CRC is always present, even for chunks containing no data

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes
member.summary: Contains a list of possible chunk type identifiers.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Header
member.summary: The first chunk in a png file. Can only exists once. Contains common information like the width and the height of the image or the used compression method.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Palette
member.summary: The PLTE chunk contains from 1 to 256 palette entries, each a three byte series in the RGB format.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Data
member.summary: The IDAT chunk contains the actual image data. The image can contains more than one chunk of this type. All chunks together are the whole image.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.End
member.summary: This chunk must appear last. It marks the end of the PNG data stream. The chunk's data field is empty.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.PaletteAlpha
member.summary: This chunk specifies that the image uses simple transparency: either alpha values associated with palette entries (for indexed-color images) or a single transparent color (for grayscale and true color images).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Text
member.summary: Textual information that the encoder wishes to record with the image can be stored in tEXt chunks. Each tEXt chunk contains a keyword and a text string.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Gamma
member.summary: This chunk specifies the relationship between the image samples and the desired display output intensity.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngChunkTypes.Physical
member.summary: The pHYs chunk specifies the intended pixel size or aspect ratio for display of the image.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType
member.summary: Provides enumeration of available PNG color types.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Grayscale
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Rgb
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.Palette
member.summary: Each pixel is a palette index; a PLTE chunk must appear.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.GrayscaleWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is a grayscale sample, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.PngColorType.RgbWithAlpha
member.summary: Each pixel is an R,G,B triple, followed by an alpha sample.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.PngDecoder
member.summary: Encoder for generating an image out of a png encoded stream.
member.remarks:
At the moment the following features are supported:
Filters: all filters are supported.
Pixel formats:
RGBA (True color) with alpha (8 bit).
RGB (True color) without alpha (8 bit).
Grayscale with alpha (8 bit).
Grayscale without alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index with alpha (8 bit).
Palette Index without alpha (8 bit).

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngHeader.BitDepth
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit depth. Bit depth is a single-byte integer giving the number of bits per sample or per palette index (not per pixel). Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, and 16, although not all values are allowed for all color types.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngHeader.ColorType
member.summary: Gets or sets the color type. Color type is a integer that describes the interpretation of the image data. Color type codes represent sums of the following values: 1 (palette used), 2 (color used), and 4 (alpha channel used).

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngHeader.CompressionMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the compression method. Indicates the method used to compress the image data. At present, only compression method 0 (deflate/inflate compression with a sliding window of at most 32768 bytes) is defined.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngHeader.FilterMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the preprocessing method. Indicates the preprocessing method applied to the image data before compression. At present, only filter method 0 (adaptive filtering with five basic filter types) is defined.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Formats.PngHeader.InterlaceMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the transmission order. Indicates the transmission order of the image data. Two values are currently defined: 0 (no interlace) or 1 (Adam7 interlace).

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32
member.summary: Computes Adler32 checksum for a stream of data. An Adler32 checksum is not as reliable as a CRC32 checksum, but a lot faster to compute.
member.remarks:
The specification for Adler32 may be found in RFC 1950. ZLIB Compressed Data Format Specification version 3.3)
From that document:
"ADLER32 (Adler-32 checksum) This contains a checksum value of the uncompressed data (excluding any dictionary data) computed according to Adler-32 algorithm. This algorithm is a 32-bit extension and improvement of the Fletcher algorithm, used in the ITU-T X.224 / ISO 8073 standard.
Adler-32 is composed of two sums accumulated per byte: s1 is the sum of all bytes, s2 is the sum of all s1 values. Both sums are done modulo 65521. s1 is initialized to 1, s2 to zero. The Adler-32 checksum is stored as s2*65536 + s1 in most- significant-byte first (network) order."
"8.2. The Adler-32 algorithm
The Adler-32 algorithm is much faster than the CRC32 algorithm yet still provides an extremely low probability of undetected errors.
The modulo on unsigned long accumulators can be delayed for 5552 bytes, so the modulo operation time is negligible. If the bytes are a, b, c, the second sum is 3a + 2b + c + 3, and so is position and order sensitive, unlike the first sum, which is just a checksum. That 65521 is prime is important to avoid a possible large class of two-byte errors that leave the check unchanged. (The Fletcher checksum uses 255, which is not prime and which also makes the Fletcher check insensitive to single byte changes 0 - 255.)
The sum s1 is initialized to 1 instead of zero to make the length of the sequence part of s2, so that the length does not have to be checked separately. (Any sequence of zeroes has a Fletcher checksum of zero.)"

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.Adler32.Base
member.summary: largest prime smaller than 65536

member.summary: The checksum calculated to far.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. The checksum starts off with a value of 1.

member.summary: Updates the checksum with a byte value.
member.param: The data value to add. The high byte of the int is ignored.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.Crc32
member.summary: Generate a table for a byte-wise 32-bit CRC calculation on the polynomial: x^32+x^26+x^23+x^22+x^16+x^12+x^11+x^10+x^8+x^7+x^5+x^4+x^2+x+1.

remarks.para: Polynomials over GF(2) are represented in binary, one bit per coefficient, with the lowest powers in the most significant bit. Then adding polynomials is just exclusive-or, and multiplying a polynomial by x is a right shift by one. If we call the above polynomial p, and represent a byte as the polynomial q, also with the lowest power in the most significant bit (so the byte 0xb1 is the polynomial x^7+x^3+x+1), then the CRC is (q*x^32) mod p, where a mod b means the remainder after dividing a by b.

This calculation is done using the shift-register method of multiplying and taking the remainder. The register is initialized to zero, and for each incoming bit, x^32 is added mod p to the register if the bit is a one (where x^32 mod p is p+x^32 = x^26+...+1), and the register is multiplied mod p by x (which is shifting right by one and adding x^32 mod p if the bit shifted out is a one). We start with the highest power (least significant bit) of q and repeat for all eight bits of q.

The table is simply the CRC of all possible eight bit values. This is all the information needed to generate CRC's on data a byte at a time for all combinations of CRC register values and incoming bytes.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Formats.IChecksum
member.summary: Interface to compute a data checksum used by checked input/output streams. A data checksum can be updated by one byte or with a byte array. After each update the value of the current checksum can be returned by calling Value. The complete checksum object can also be reset so it can be used again with new data.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Formats.ZlibDeflateStream.isDisposed
member.summary: A value indicating whether this instance of the given entity has been disposed.
member.value: if this instance has been disposed; otherwise, .
member.remarks: If the entity is disposed, it must not be disposed a second time. The isDisposed field is set the first time the entity is disposed. If the isDisposed field is true, then the Dispose() method will not dispose again. This help not to prolong the entity's life in the Garbage Collector.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode
member.summary: Enumerated resize modes to apply to resized images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Crop
member.summary: Crops the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Pad
member.summary: Pads the resized image to fit the bounds of its container. If only one dimension is passed, will maintain the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.BoxPad
member.summary: Pads the image to fit the bound of the container without resizing the original source. When downscaling, performs the same functionality as

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Max
member.summary: Constrains the resized image to fit the bounds of its container maintaining the original aspect ratio.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Min
member.summary: Resizes the image until the shortest side reaches the set given dimension. Upscaling is disabled in this mode and the original image will be returned if attempted.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Processing.ResizeMode.Stretch
member.summary: Stretches the resized image to fit the bounds of its container.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.BicubicResampler
member.summary: The function implements the bicubic kernel algorithm W(x) as described on Wikipedia A commonly used algorithm within imageprocessing that preserves sharpness better than triangle interpolation.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.BoxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the box algorithm. Similar to nearest neighbor when upscaling. When downscaling the pixels will average, merging together.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.CatmullRomResampler
member.summary: The Catmull-Rom filter is a well known standard Cubic Filter often used as a interpolation function. This filter produces a reasonably sharp edge, but without a the pronounced gradient change on large scale image enlargements that a 'Lagrange' filter can produce.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.HermiteResampler
member.summary: The Hermite filter is type of smoothed triangular interpolation Filter, This filter rounds off strong edges while preserving flat 'color levels' in the original image.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.IResampler
member.summary: Encapsulates an interpolation algorithm for resampling images.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.Processing.IResampler.Radius
member.summary: Gets the radius in which to sample pixels.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Processing.IResampler.GetValue(System.Single)
member.summary: Gets the result of the interpolation algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.Lanczos2Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 2 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.Lanczos3Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 3 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.Lanczos5Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 5 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.Lanczos8Resampler
member.summary: The function implements the Lanczos kernel algorithm as described on Wikipedia with a radius of 8 pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.MitchellNetravaliResampler
member.summary: The function implements the mitchell algorithm as described on Wikipedia

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.NearestNeighborResampler
member.summary: The function implements the nearest neighbor algorithm. This uses an unscaled filter which will select the closest pixel to the new pixels position.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.RobidouxResampler
member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.RobidouxSharpResampler
member.summary: The function implements the Robidoux Sharp algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.SplineResampler
member.summary: The function implements the spline algorithm.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.TriangleResampler
member.summary: The function implements the triangle (bilinear) algorithm. Bilinear interpolation can be used where perfect image transformation with pixel matching is impossible, so that one can calculate and assign appropriate intensity values to pixels.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Processing.WelchResampler
member.summary: The function implements the welch algorithm.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.ImageBase`1.isDisposed
member.summary: A value indicating whether this instance of the given entity has been disposed.
member.value: if this instance has been disposed; otherwise, .
member.remarks: If the entity is disposed, it must not be disposed a second time. The isDisposed field is set the first time the entity is disposed. If the isDisposed field is true, then the Dispose() method will not dispose again. This help not to prolong the entity's life in the Garbage Collector.

member.summary: Reads a 64-bit unsigned integer from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.

member.summary: Reads a single-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 4 bytes are read.

member.summary: Reads a double-precision floating-point value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 8 bytes are read.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadDecimal
member.summary: Reads a decimal value from the stream, using the bit converter for this reader. 16 bytes are read.

member.param: The buffer to copy data into
The first index to copy data into

member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will return what is available.
member.param: The number of bytes to read

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBytesOrThrow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the specified number of bytes, returning them in a new byte array. If not enough bytes are available before the end of the stream, this method will throw an IOException.
member.param: The number of bytes to read

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Read7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the least significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadBigEndian7BitEncodedInt
member.summary: Reads a 7-bit encoded integer from the stream. This is stored with the most significant information first, with 7 bits of information per byte of value, and the top bit as a continuation flag. This method is not affected by the endianness of the bit converter.
member.returns: The 7-bit encoded integer read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.ReadString
member.summary: Reads a length-prefixed string from the stream, using the encoding for this reader. A 7-bit encoded integer is first read, which specifies the number of bytes to read from the stream. These bytes are then converted into a string with the encoding for this reader.
member.returns: The string read from the stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.Dispose
member.summary: Disposes of the underlying stream.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.IO.EndianBinaryReader.CheckDisposed
member.summary: Checks whether or not the reader has been disposed, throwing an exception if so.

member.remarks: Different computer architectures store data using different byte orders. "Big-endian" means the most significant byte is on the left end of a word. "Little-endian" means the most significant byte is on the right end of a word.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.ImageMetaData.VerticalResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the resolution of the image in y- direction. It is defined as the number of dots per inch and should be an positive value.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IMetaData
member.summary: Encapsulates the metadata of an image frame.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.IMetaData.FrameDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets the frame delay for animated images. If not 0, when utilized in Gif animation, this field specifies the number of hundredths (1/100) of a second to wait before continuing with the processing of the Data Stream. The clock starts ticking immediately after the graphic is rendered.

member.name: P:ImageSharp.IMetaData.DisposalMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the disposal method for animated images. Primarily used in Gif animation, this field indicates the way in which the graphic is to be treated after being displayed.

member.summary: ISO 5-3 densitometer response for measuring color negatives

member.summary:
CIE 122-1996:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = 0

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccParametricCurveType.Iec61966_3
member.summary:
IEC 61966-3:
For X >= -b/a: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; -b/a: Y = c

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccParametricCurveType.SRgb
member.summary:
IEC 61966-2-1 (sRGB):
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccParametricCurveType.Type5
member.summary:
Type 5:
For X >= d: Y =(a * X + b)^g + c
For X $lt; d: Y = c * X + f

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass
member.summary: Profile Class Name

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.InputDevice
member.summary: Input profiles are generally used with devices such as scanners and digital cameras. The types of profiles available for use as Input profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.DisplayDevice
member.summary: This class of profiles represents display devices such as monitors. The types of profiles available for use as Display profiles are N-component LUT-based, Three-component matrix-based, and monochrome.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.OutputDevice
member.summary: Output profiles are used to support devices such as printers and film recorders. The types of profiles available for use as Output profiles are N-component LUT-based and Monochrome.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.DeviceLink
member.summary: This profile contains a pre-evaluated transform that cannot be undone, which represents a one-way link or connection between devices. It does not represent any device model nor can it be embedded into images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.ColorSpace
member.summary: This profile provides the relevant information to perform a transformation between colour encodings and the PCS. This type of profile is based on modelling rather than device measurement or characterization data. ColorSpace profiles may be embedded in images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.Abstract
member.summary: This profile represents abstract transforms and does not represent any device model. Colour transformations using Abstract profiles are performed from PCS to PCS. Abstract profiles cannot be embedded in images.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileClass.NamedColor
member.summary: NamedColor profiles can be thought of as sibling profiles to device profiles. For a given device there would be one or more device profiles to handle process colour conversions and one or more named colour profiles to handle named colours.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag
member.summary: Profile flags. Can be combined with a logical OR. The least-significant 16 bits are reserved for the ICC, the rest can be used for vendor specific values

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag.None
member.summary: No flags (equivalent to NotEmbedded and Independent)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag.Embedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag.NotEmbedded
member.summary: Profile is embedded within another file

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag.NotIndependent
member.summary: Profile cannot be used independently of the embedded colour data

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileFlag.Independent
member.summary: Profile can be used independently of the embedded colour data

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag
member.summary:
Enumerates the ICC Profile Tags as defined in ICC.1:2010 version 4.3.0.0 Section 9
Each tag value represent the size of the tag in the profile.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown tag

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.AToB0
member.summary: A2B0 - This tag defines a colour transform from Device, Colour Encoding or PCS, to PCS, or a colour transform from Device 1 to Device 2, using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.AToB1
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the colour transform from Device or Colour Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.AToB2
member.summary: A2B2 - This tag describes the colour transform from Device or Colour Encoding to PCS using lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BlueMatrixColumn
member.summary: bXYZ - This tag contains the third column in the matrix used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BlueTrc
member.summary: bTRC - This tag contains the blue channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (blue) or 100 % phosphor (blue).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToA0
member.summary: B2A0 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device or Colour Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToA1
member.summary: B2A1 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device or Colour Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToA2
member.summary: B2A2 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device or Colour Encoding using the lookup table tag element structures.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToD0
member.summary: B2D0 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA0 tag.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToD1
member.summary: B2D1 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToD2
member.summary: B2D2 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA2 tag.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.BToD3
member.summary: B2D3 - This tag defines a colour transform from PCS to Device. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the BToA1 tag.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.CalibrationDateTime
member.summary: calt - This tag contains the profile calibration date and time. This allows applications and utilities to verify if this profile matches a vendor's profile and how recently calibration has been performed.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.CharTarget
member.summary: targ - This tag contains the name of the registered characterization data set, or it contains the measurement data for a characterization target.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.ChromaticAdaptation
member.summary: chad - This tag contains a matrix, which shall be invertible, and which converts an nCIEXYZ colour, measured using the actual illumination conditions and relative to the actual adopted white, to an nCIEXYZ colour relative to the PCS adopted white

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Chromaticity
member.summary: chrm - This tag contains the type and the data of the phosphor/colorant chromaticity set used.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.ColorantOrder
member.summary: clro - This tag specifies the laydown order of colorants.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.ColorantTable
member.summary: clrt

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.ColorantTableOut
member.summary: clot - This tag identifies the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values. When used in DeviceLink profiles only the PCSLAB values shall be permitted.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.ColorimetricIntentImageStat
member.summary: ciis - This tag indicates the image state of PCS colorimetry produced using the colorimetric intent transforms.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Copyright
member.summary: cprt - This tag contains the text copyright information for the profile.

member.summary: dmnd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device manufacturer for display

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DeviceModelDescription
member.summary: dmdd - This tag describes the structure containing invariant and localizable versions of the device model for display.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DeviceSettings
member.summary: devs - Removed in V4

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DToB0
member.summary: D2B0 - This tag defines a colour transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB0 tag

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DToB1
member.summary: D2B1 - This tag defines a colour transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DToB2
member.summary: D2B2 - This tag defines a colour transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.DToB3
member.summary: D2B3 - This tag defines a colour transform from Device to PCS. It supports float32Number-encoded input range, output range and transform, and provides a means to override the AToB1 tag

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Gamut
member.summary: gamt - This tag provides a table in which PCS values are the input and a single output value for each input value is the output. If the output value is 0, the PCS colour is in-gamut. If the output is non-zero, the PCS colour is out-of-gamut

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.GrayTrc
member.summary: kTRC - This tag contains the grey tone reproduction curve. The tone reproduction curve provides the necessary information to convert between a single device channel and the PCSXYZ or PCSLAB encoding.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.GreenMatrixColumn
member.summary: gXYZ - This tag contains the second column in the matrix, which is used in matrix/TRC transforms.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.GreenTrc
member.summary: gTRC - This tag contains the green channel tone reproduction curve. The first element represents no colorant (white) or phosphor (black) and the last element represents 100 % colorant (green) or 100 % phosphor (green).

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Luminance
member.summary: lumi - This tag contains the absolute luminance of emissive devices in candelas per square metre as described by the Y channel.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.Measurement
member.summary: meas - This tag describes the alternative measurement specification, such as a D65 illuminant instead of the default D50.

member.summary: bkpt - Removed in V4

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.MediaWhitePoint
member.summary: wtpt - This tag, which is used for generating the ICC-absolute colorimetric intent, specifies the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the media white point.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccProfileTag.NamedColor
member.summary: ncol - OBSOLETE, use

member.summary: ncl2 - This tag contains the named colour information providing a PCS and optional device representation for a list of named colours.

member.summary: resp - This tag describes the structure containing a description of the device response for which the profile is intended.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IccRenderingIntent
member.summary: Rendering intent

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccRenderingIntent.Perceptual
member.summary: In perceptual transforms the PCS values represent hypothetical measurements of a colour reproduction on the reference reflective medium. By extension, for the perceptual intent, the PCS represents the appearance of that reproduction as viewed in the reference viewing environment by a human observer adapted to that environment. The exact colour rendering of the perceptual intent is vendor specific.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccRenderingIntent.MediaRelativeColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall re-scale the in-gamut, chromatically adapted tristimulus values such that the white point of the actual medium is mapped to the PCS white point (for either input or output)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccRenderingIntent.Saturation
member.summary: The exact colour rendering of the saturation intent is vendor specific and involves compromises such as trading off preservation of hue in order to preserve the vividness of pure colours.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccRenderingIntent.AbsoluteColorimetric
member.summary: Transformations for this intent shall leave the chromatically adapted nCIEXYZ tristimulus values of the in-gamut colours unchanged.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature
member.summary: Type Signature

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Unknown
member.summary: Unknown type signature

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Chromaticity
member.summary: The chromaticity tag type provides basic chromaticity data and type of phosphors or colorants of a monitor to applications and utilities

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ColorantOrder
member.summary: This is an optional tag which specifies the laydown order in which colorants will be printed on an n-colorant device. The laydown order may be the same as the channel generation order listed in the colorantTableTag or the channel order of a colour encoding type such as CMYK, in which case this tag is not needed. When this is not the case (for example, ink-towers sometimes use the order KCMY), this tag may be used to specify the laydown order of the colorants

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ColorantTable
member.summary: The purpose of this tag is to identify the colorants used in the profile by a unique name and set of PCSXYZ or PCSLAB values to give the colorant an unambiguous value. The first colorant listed is the colorant of the first device channel of a LUT tag. The second colorant listed is the colorant of the second device channel of a LUT tag, and so on

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Curve
member.summary: The curveType embodies a one-dimensional function which maps an input value in the domain of the function to an output value in the range of the function

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Data
member.summary: The dataType is a simple data structure that contains either 7-bit ASCII or binary data

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.DateTime
member.summary: Date and time defined by 6 unsigned 16bit integers (year, month, day, hour, minute, second)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Lut16
member.summary: This structure represents a colour transform using tables with 16-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input colour space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Lut8
member.summary: This structure represents a colour transform using tables of 8-bit precision. This type contains four processing elements: a 3 3 matrix (which shall be the identity matrix unless the input colour space is PCSXYZ), a set of one-dimensional input tables, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output tables.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.LutAToB
member.summary: This structure represents a colour transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the AToBTag tag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional output curves

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.LutBToA
member.summary: This structure represents a colour transform. The type contains up to five processing elements which are stored in the BToATag in the following order: a set of one-dimensional curves, a 3 3 matrix with offset terms, a set of one-dimensional curves, a multi-dimensional lookup table, and a set of one-dimensional curves.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Measurement
member.summary: This information refers only to the internal profile data and is meant to provide profile makers an alternative to the default measurement specifications

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.MultiLocalizedUnicode
member.summary: This tag structure contains a set of records each referencing a multilingual Unicode string associated with a profile. Each string is referenced in a separate record with the information about what language and region the string is for.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.MultiProcessElements
member.summary: This structure represents a colour transform, containing a sequence of processing elements. The processing elements contained in the structure are defined in the structure itself, allowing for a flexible structure. Currently supported processing elements are: a set of one dimensional curves, a matrix with offset terms, and a multidimensional lookup table (CLUT). Other processing element types may be added in the future. Each type of processing element may be contained any number of times in the structure.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor2
member.summary: This type is a count value and array of structures that provide colour coordinates for colour names. For each named colour, a PCS and optional device representation of the colour are given. Both representations are 16-bit values and PCS values shall be relative colorimetric. The device representation corresponds to the headers "data colour space" field. This representation should be consistent with the "number of device coordinates" field in the namedColor2Type. If this field is 0, device coordinates are not provided. The PCS representation corresponds to the header's PCS field. The PCS representation is always provided. Colour names are fixed-length, 32-byte fields including null termination. In order to maintain maximum portability, it is strongly recommended that special characters of the 7-bit ASCII set not be used.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ParametricCurve
member.summary: This type describes a one-dimensional curve by specifying one of a predefined set of functions using the parameters.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceDesc
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information from the header fields and tags from the original profiles which were combined to create the final profile. The order of the structures is the order in which the profiles were combined and includes a structure for the final profile. This provides a description of the profile sequence from source to destination, typically used with the DeviceLink profile.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ProfileSequenceIdentifier
member.summary: This type is an array of structures, each of which contains information for identification of a profile used in a sequence.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ResponseCurveSet16
member.summary: The purpose of this tag type is to provide a mechanism to relate physical colorant amounts with the normalized device codes produced by lut8Type, lut16Type, lutAToBType, lutBToAType or multiProcessElementsType tags so that corrections can be made for variation in the device without having to produce a new profile. The mechanism can be used by applications to allow users with relatively inexpensive and readily available instrumentation to apply corrections to individual output colour channels in order to achieve consistent results.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.S15Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of signed floating point numbers with 1 sign bit, 15 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Signature
member.summary: The signatureType contains a 4-byte sequence. Sequences of less than four characters are padded at the end with spaces. Typically this type is used for registered tags that can be displayed on many development systems as a sequence of four characters.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Text
member.summary: Simple ASCII text

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.U16Fixed16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned floating point numbers with 16 value bits and 16 fractional bits

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.UInt16Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 16bit integers (ushort)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.UInt32Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 32bit integers (uint)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.UInt64Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 64bit integers (ulong)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.UInt8Array
member.summary: Array of unsigned 8bit integers (byte)

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.ViewingConditions
member.summary: This type represents a set of viewing condition parameters.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Xyz
member.summary: 3 floating point values describing a XYZ color value

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.TextDescription
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The textDescriptionType is a complex structure that contains three types of text description structures: 7-bit ASCII, Unicode and ScriptCode. Since no single standard method for specifying localizable character sets exists across the major platform vendors, including all three provides access for the major operating systems. The 7-bit ASCII description is to be an invariant, nonlocalizable name for consistent reference. It is preferred that both the Unicode and ScriptCode structures be properly localized.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.CrdInfo
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains the PostScript product name to which this profile corresponds and the names of the companion CRDs

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.Screening
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - The screeningType describes various screening parameters including screen frequency, screening angle, and spot shape

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.UcrBg
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type contains curves representing the under color removal and black generation and a text string which is a general description of the method used for the UCR and BG

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.DeviceSettings
member.summary: REMOVED IN V4 - This type is an array of structures each of which contains platform-specific information about the settings of the device for which this profile is valid. This type is not supported.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.IccTypeSignature.NamedColor
member.summary: REMOVED IN V2 - use instead. This type is not supported.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Argb32
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in alpha, red, green, and blue order.
Ranges from <0, 0, 0, 0> to <1, 1, 1, 1> in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.

member.summary: Assists with the conversion of known packed pixel formats from one to another.

member.summary: A non operative function. Simply returns the original vector.

member.summary: Returns the correct scaling function for the given types The compute scale function.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromStandardNormalizedType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector values representing all four components ranging from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromStandardType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector values representing all four components ranging from 0 to 255.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromOffsetNormalizedType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector values representing all four components ranging from -1 to 1.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromOffsetType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector values representing all four components ranging from -32767 to 32767.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromOffsetTwoComponentNormalizedType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector with the first component pair ranging from -1 to 1. and the second component pair ranging from 0 to 1.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.FromOffsetTwoComponentType(System.Type)
member.summary: Returns the correct conversion function to convert from types having vector with the first component pair ranging from -32767 to 32767. and the second component pair ranging from 0 to 1.

member.summary: Identifies the type as having vector component values ranging from 0 to 1.

member.summary: Identifies the type as having vector component values ranging from 0 to 255.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.IsOffsetTwoComponentNormalizedType(System.Type)

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.IsOffsetNormalizedType(System.Type)
member.summary: Identifies the type as having vector values representing all four components ranging from -1 to 1.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.IsOffsetTwoComponentType(System.Type)

member.name: M:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PackedPixelConverterHelper.IsOffsetType(System.Type)

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode
member.summary: The various blending modes.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Normal
member.summary: Default blending mode, also known as "Normal" or "Alpha Blending"

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Multiply
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by multiplication.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Add
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by addition.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Substract
member.summary: Blends the 2 values by subtraction.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Screen
member.summary: Multiplies the complements of the backdrop and source values, then complements the result.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Darken
member.summary: Selects the minimum of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Lighten
member.summary: Selects the max of the backdrop and source values.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Overlay
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the values, depending on the backdrop vector values.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.HardLight
member.summary: Multiplies or screens the colors, depending on the source value.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Src
member.summary: returns the source colors

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Atop
member.summary: returns the source over the destination

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Over
member.summary: returns the detination over the source

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.In
member.summary: the source where the desitnation and source overlap

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Out
member.summary: the destination where the desitnation and source overlap

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Dest
member.summary: the destination where the source does not overlap it

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestAtop
member.summary: the source where they dont overlap othersie dest in overlapping parts

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestOver
member.summary: the destnation over the source

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestIn
member.summary: the destination where the desitnation and source overlap

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.DestOut
member.summary: the source where the desitnation and source overlap

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Clear
member.summary: the clear.

member.name: F:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenderMode.Xor
member.summary: clear where they overlap

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.DefaultPixelBlenders`1
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying different composition models.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.PixelBlenders.PorterDuffFunctions
member.summary: Collection of Porter Duff alpha blending functions applying an the 'Over' composition model.
member.remarks: These functions are designed to be a general solution for all color cases, that is, they take in account the alpha value of both the backdrop and source, and there's no need to alpha-premultiply neither the backdrop nor the source. Note there are faster functions for when the backdrop color is known to be opaque

member.summary: Source over backdrop

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Rg32

Ranges from <0, 0, 0, 1> to <1, 1, 0, 1> in vector form.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.Rgba1010102
member.summary:
Packed vector type containing unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 1. The x, y and z components use 10 bits, and the w component uses 2 bits.
Ranges from <0, 0, 0, 0> to <1, 1, 1, 1> in vector form.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.PixelFormats.RgbaVector
member.summary:
Unpacked pixel type containing four 16-bit floating-point values typically ranging from 0 to 1. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order.
Ranges from <0, 0, 0, 0> to <1, 1, 1, 1> in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

Packed pixel type containing two 16-bit signed integer values.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Rgba32
member.content: Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.
member.summary:
Packed pixel type containing four 8-bit unsigned normalized values ranging from 0 to 255. The color components are stored in red, green, blue, and alpha order.
Ranges from <0, 0, 0, 0> to <1, 1, 1, 1> in vector form.
member.remarks: This struct is fully mutable. This is done (against the guidelines) for the sake of performance, as it avoids the need to create new values for modification operations.
member.content: Provides standardized deifinitions for named colors.
Provides optimized overrides for bulk operations.

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Rgba32.PixelOperations
member.summary: implementation optimized for .

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Rgba32.PixelOperations.ToVector4SimdAligned(System.Span{ImageSharp.Rgba32},System.Span{System.Numerics.Vector4},System.Int32)
member.summary: SIMD optimized bulk implementation of that works only with `count` divisible by .
member.param: The number of pixels to convert.
member.remarks:
Implementation adapted from:
http://stackoverflow.com/a/5362789
TODO: We can replace this implementation in the future using new Vector API-s:
https://github.com/dotnet/corefx/issues/15957

member.name: F:ImageSharp.Quantizers.Quantizer`1.singlePass
member.summary: Flag used to indicate whether a single pass or two passes are needed for quantization.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.Quantizer`1.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: If true, the quantization only needs to loop through the source pixels once
member.remarks: If you construct this class with a true value for singlePass, then the code will, when quantizing your image, only call the 'QuantizeImage' function. If two passes are required, the code will call 'InitialQuantizeImage' and then 'QuantizeImage'.

member.summary: Override this to process the pixel in the first pass of the algorithm

member.name: T:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1
member.summary: An implementation of Wu's color quantizer with alpha channel.

remarks.para: Based on C Implementation of Xiaolin Wu's Color Quantizer (v. 2) (see Graphics Gems volume II, pages 126-133) ().
This adaptation is based on the excellent JeremyAnsel.ColorQuant by J챕r챕my Ansel

Algorithm: Greedy orthogonal bipartition of RGB space for variance minimization aided by inclusion-exclusion tricks. For speed no nearest neighbor search is done. Slightly better performance can be expected by more sophisticated but more expensive versions.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: The Wu quantizer is a two pass algorithm. The initial pass sets up the 3-D color histogram, the second pass quantizes a color based on the position in the histogram.

member.summary: Computes sum over a box of any given statistic.

member.summary: Computes part of Volume(cube, moment) that doesn't depend on r1, g1, or b1 (depending on direction).

member.summary: Computes remainder of Volume(cube, moment), substituting position for r1, g1, or b1 (depending on direction).

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.Get3DMoments
member.summary: Converts the histogram into moments so that we can rapidly calculate the sums of the above quantities over any desired box.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.Variance(ImageSharp.Quantizers.Box)
member.summary: Computes the weighted variance of a box cube.

member.name: M:ImageSharp.Quantizers.WuQuantizer`1.Maximize(ImageSharp.Quantizers.Box,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: We want to minimize the sum of the variances of two sub-boxes. The sum(c^2) terms can be ignored since their sum over both sub-boxes is the same (the sum for the whole box) no matter where we split. The remaining terms have a minus sign in the variance formula, so we drop the minus sign and maximize the sum of the two terms.
